com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.commands.impl

Class MoreSuggestionsCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu.AbstractLocalizedCommand
      • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.dialogs.menu.AbstractNotifingLocalizedCommand
        • com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.commands.impl.MoreSuggestionsCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class MoreSuggestionsCommand
extends AbstractNotifingLocalizedCommand
    The class MoreSuggestionsCommand adds a sub-menu to the context-menu that contains a number of ReplaceCommands.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public CommandType getType()
        Returns:
        The type of the command. This could be used to identify and filter or highlight special commands. Not every command has an own type. In this case CommandType.NULL will be used.

      • canBeChecked

        public boolean canBeChecked()
        Returns:
        true, if the command could be checked. This means the button could stay pressed. In some GUI-frameworks you have to use different buttons or menu entries for this kind of button. The state, if the button is pressed or not could be queried by Command.isChecked().

      • getCommands

        public List<Command> getCommands()
        Specified by:
        getCommands in interface Command
        Returns:
        an empty list of commands

      • isIndented

        public boolean isIndented()
        Specified by:
        isIndented in interface Command
        Returns:
        false; override this method if you want to indent the command in a menu

      • isBold

        public boolean isBold()
        Specified by:
        isBold in interface Command
        Returns:
        false. If you want to display the text in bold you have to override this method. Note: It's not possible to display text in bold in all GUI frameworks. It is possible that this property won't have any effect.

      • getTextColor

        public MarkingColor getTextColor()
        Specified by:
        getTextColor in interface Command
        Returns:
        null; override this method if you want to return another text color than the default one

      • isEnabled

        Specified by:

      • isChecked

        public boolean isChecked()
        Specified by:
        isChecked in interface Command
        Returns:
        false; override this method if you want the command to be checkable. You could use a ToggleCommand.
